website_summaries.verdict: With "guess what I'm thinking" as the basis, this game uses creative ways to get players to guess other players answers.
pros: Simple game and can be completed in a short amount of time
Guess box plays fun music that builds suspense
cons: Players tend to shout answers before sculpting or drawing even gets started

customer_reviews.title: Family game
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game to play with the family. Anyone can play, kids and adults. We have a great time playing this with our teenagers
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremley Enjoyable
customer_reviews.text: This was bought as a gift for my sisters family. They love the game, because not only does it get their son (11) away from the video games and tv, but you can play a round in a reasonable amount of time. This game is pull out after family get togethers as a means of enjoying family time together. And you learn alot about each other.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mostly OK
customer_reviews.text: The game itself is ok - our particular item seems to have been repackaged. All of the parts were there so there was no need to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Louis S. Lau

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and Fun for the Family
customer_reviews.text: I had some trepidation when I purchased it because some of the Crainium games can get a little too predictable. However, we have two 8 year old grandchildren and this game was the hit of the holiday season. We were really pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Lprofessor

customer_reviews.title: This game is so simple and so much fun. I wanted a nice uncomplicated family game and ...
customer_reviews.text: This game is so simple and so much fun. I wanted a nice uncomplicated family game and this fits the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Tatianne14

customer_reviews.title: if you're tired of board games-
customer_reviews.text: Cranium Conga is fast paced, fun, and different enough to attract people who think they don't like games. It is a blast to play! Players take turns guessing what is written on the electronic timer's hidden screen. You might be asked to guess what player A has written in answer to "What is the job you'd like least?" or you might have to figure out that player B has sculpted a hotdog out of playdough. This is fun for all ages, as long as the players can read the cards.
customer_reviews.author: Lorel Shea

customer_reviews.title: Great fun every time
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite game. Everytime i get anyone to play games with me, i pull this one out. The questions are fun and each time we get to know something unique or interesting about others. Unlike some of the other cranium games, this one is easy and fast, so there's no problem with pre-teens playing with adults--no one has an unfair advantage, everyone is equally likely to do well and/or win.
customer_reviews.author: B. Miller

customer_reviews.title: REALLY fun for the WHOLE family!
customer_reviews.text: Our entire family, including the 9 and 16 year olds, have a blast playing this game. We learn things about each other, laugh, and race the clock. It's so rare to find a game for the kids that the parents actually have fun playing as well! We're going to invite some family friends over for dinner & game night soon...
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Conga is Bouncy Fun!!!
customer_reviews.text: From the fun music to the guess box this game ROCKS!!!! There is never a dull moment. Although the game is rated for kids 8 and up, younger kids even some 5 year olds, would enjoy it with just a little help with reading. Passing around the guess box with the music going is great fun- kind of like playing hot potato. Like some of the other great games by CRANIUM the clay adds a fun dimension and encourages creativity. This game would be good for HOURS of fun for the whole family!! Take it from a mother of 4. This game is great and a different change of pace from the others out there.
customer_reviews.author: Francine Sheedy

customer_reviews.title: Not as much fun...
customer_reviews.text: Thought this would be a huge hit... not so much fun as they make it sound. Kids find it a bit dry, easy and boring --- and parents will dread this game. Save yourself now -- don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Kossie

customer_reviews.title: FUN FUN FUN!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game for my 9 year old daughter as part as a promotional deal (I got this game for free)! Since it was only 3 of us, we thought it would be more fun with more people, so we invited over my parents. We played for the first time last night and we had a blast. At first the directions seemed a little too much, but once we started playing, everyone caught on real quick!! Some of the questions were hard to think up of answers, some were easy, but it was all very fun!! We all cannot wait to play again!! This is a great game, not only for the kids, but even for adults only!!
customer_reviews.author: Chellriana

customer_reviews.title: Three cheers!
customer_reviews.text: Adding to the acclaim here--the Cranium games are all fun, but this is just the best. It's especially good for multiage groups and family gatherings--one of the few games where being older and sharper doesn't confer much advantage. Even kids who don't really read and write yet can play with adult help and have fun. Another plus: We ran into a bit of a problem with a defective part and Cranium's customer service was absolutely first-rate in resolving it. Anyone who buys anything these days knows how rare that is!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: A little boring...
customer_reviews.text: Not much challenge to this game. Maybe it would be fun for kids, but too simple for adults. We played twice then donated it to charity.
customer_reviews.author: Seeley Gal

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun & Family Time With Your Kids
customer_reviews.text: My Husband & I Played Cranium The regular version for the 1st time about 2 weeks ago, and it was a blast!(recommended also) So when I saw this version I thought perfect! Since we have 3 kids, 2 of playing age.. I decided to get it. We played last night, The rules are simple and easy for the kids to understand. The kids were great & enjoyed playing as much as we did. It got my husband involved(& he actually enjoyed it)LOL... & it meant a lot to the kids, that they can spend time & have FUN with their parents! :o) I'd say it's an A+ game for family fun!
customer_reviews.author: bizzy_mom_3

customer_reviews.title: Literally, fun for ALL ages!
customer_reviews.text: My 17 year old brother, my 8 and 10 year old (female) cousins, and my 21 year old self played this game after Thanksgiving dinner and within minutes had jealous adults watching our fun (we let them join in the next round). Though our 4 and 2 year old cousins were too young to really play (reading and writing required), they were content to watch and laugh with us. We all laughed so hard and had the best time. This is definitely the stuff the best family memories are made of.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This game is a-lot of fun!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for Christmas a few years ago and it is one of the most fun games around! It is great to play at a party and all ages can play! If you dont have a-lot of people to play with, it is less fun. It is like the regular Cranium except you have to write your answers in a electronic pad thing. This is a-lot easier to play and like all the cranium games, I have never had a problem with it. This is a great game to buy!
customer_reviews.author: Dolphin Lover

customer_reviews.title: Fun for everyone!
customer_reviews.text: We received this game from a friend at Christmas time. The kids had two weeks off - what to do?!! What a blast and funny too! Everyone gets involved even when it's not your turn. Winning doesn't seem to be as important as it is getting the other players to guess your answer. Our youngest one who can't read really well just yet enjoyed the lively game as much as our oldest two. And we, as the parents, thought our friends would like it too!
customer_reviews.author: Lively in Leesburg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent game for kids and tweens
customer_reviews.text: Kids ages 10- 13 have played this game with the adults. We all enjoy it. Only problem is the magnetic pencil lost it's magnet the first day. We play despite the problem.
customer_reviews.author: J. Perullo

product_meta.title: CRANIUM Conga
product_meta.description:
How many trees has your mom climbed in her lifetime? What does your best friend wish her nickname could be? And just what kind of an animal is your brother sculpting? These thought-evoking questions bring families and friends closer together as they share an evening of hilarious facts and treasured memories. Includes 300 game cards, musical timer, erasable secret answer pad, 3 scoring cases, 96 scoring tiles and a tub of cool Cranium Clay. Imported.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Cranium Conga is the fast-paced "guess what I'm thinking?" game that will get your whole family acting, sculpting, guesstimating, and picking hilarious words. Conga celebrates the fun facts and funny memories that only someone close to you would know. It provides giggles and laughs for everyone from an 8-year-old, to a teenager, to even Mom and Dad so turn off the TV and share in some high-fiving fun! For 3 to 6 players, ages 8 and up.
feature_bullets: Cranium Conga is a true family game that has the soul of Cranium and gives everyone in the family
Designed to get families to turn off the TV and have fun together
The variety of "guess what I'm thinking?" content and beat-the-buzzer guessing ensure it's never the same game twice
Cranium Conga includes more than 300 outrageously fun game cards, a musical timer with an erasable secret
Also includes answer pad, 6 Conga scoring cases, 96 scoring tiles, and a tub of cool Cranium Clay
Cranium Conga gets everyone laughing out loud about fun facts and inside jokes that only close friends and family would know

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars28 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
